article_title: Investors Dig for Winners in Commodity Currencies
article_text:
SYDNEY—The U.S. dollar’s surge to an almost 13-year high against major global currencies is beginning to spur a flurry of contrarian bets.

While the consensus view is that the greenback will keep climbing once the U.S. begins raising interest rates, some strategists are trying to pick winners from among the likeliest losers—commodity currencies.

Some are using unusual methods in a bid to gain an edge in the trade, from...

SYDNEY—The U.S. dollar’s surge to an almost 13-year high against major global currencies is beginning to spur a flurry of contrarian bets.
While the consensus view is that the greenback will keep climbing once the U.S. begins raising interest rates, some strategists are trying to pick winners from among the likeliest losers—commodity currencies.
